allow: Bash(git commit -m "docs: update CHANGELOG for v0.5.2 final release")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
fix: add whitelist to typo detector for common identifiers

Problem:
- !this flagged as typo: "Did you mean 'then'?"
- Other common identifiers like ''ce'', ''world'', ''owner'' also triggered false positives
- Levenshtein distance too sensitive for short common words

Solution:
- Added VALID_IDENTIFIERS whitelist with common PML identifiers
- Skip typo detection for whitelisted identifiers:
  - this (form context)
  - ce (Current Element)
  - world, owner, name, type (common variable names)
  - result, error, value, data (common return values)
  - item, list, count, index (loop variables)

Now !this and other common identifiers won''t trigger typo warnings!

v0.5.2
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "fix: resolve ESLint warnings in build

- Replace require(''fs'') with import * as fs in languageClient.ts
- Add _ prefix to unused parameters (token, context, document)
- Remove unused local variables (params)

Fixes GitHub Actions build warnings")

Bash(git commit -m "chore: release v0.5.3 - revert type inference

Type inference was too complex and not working correctly.
Reverted to stable version with only essential fixes:

- ✅ LSP server works in production mode
- ✅ Form files (.pmlfrm) don''t show parser errors  
- ✅ object ARRAY() syntax supported
- ✅ !this and common identifiers don''t trigger typo warnings
- ✅ ESLint warnings resolved

v0.5.3")
